channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Facial recognition systems tests fail to record accuracy for Māori
item.description: Tests of the main facial recognition system used to produce passports did not record how accurate it is on Māori.

item.title: Person dies after driving at high speed and hitting power poles
item.description: A person has died after a car crashed in the early hours in Mount Roskill, Auckland.

item.title: Covid-19: Get vaccinated to help avoid level 4 again - Health Minister
item.description: Level four lockdowns could become a thing of the past if Covid-19 vaccination rates are high enough, the health minister has signalled.

item.title: Covid-19: Couple caught out in Taupo, Aucklanders flock to beaches
item.description: A couple has been arrested for using false information to pass the southern Tāmaki Makaurau border to stay in Taupo, and a group was caught fishing in Mission Bay.

item.title: Timaru tragedy: Woman charged with murder of three daughters appears in court
item.description: The woman charged with the murder of her three daughters in their Timaru home on Thursday night has appeared in court this morning.

item.title: Hospitality businesses consider no-vax, no entry policy
item.description: A Tāmaki Makaurau businessman is gathering support for a no-vax, no-entry policy at bars, cafés and restaurants.

item.title: Search continues for missing father and children
item.description: Family and friends scoured the rugged King Country coastline today at Marokopa and Kiritehere beaches today, but still had no luck finding Thomas Phillips and his children, or any items of interest.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 20 new community cases in New Zealand today
item.description: The number of new community cases of Covid-19 has jumped after several days of falling numbers, with 20 new cases reported in Auckland today.

item.title: Body found at Foxton Beach
item.description: A body was found at Foxton Beach at about midday today.

item.title: Lockdowns push families and migrants to the edge - advocates
item.description: Lockdowns and restrictions have pushed some families and groups to the bone financially, and the government needs to offer better support, social support groups say.

item.title: LynnMall attack: National, charities critical of gaps in terrorist inquiry
item.description: The Auckland terrorist's immigration history is a glaring omission in the review of events leading to the 3 September attacks, National says.

item.title: Latest Transmission Gully delay blamed on Covid-19 outbreak
item.description: Level 3 restrictions and supply chain problems mean a new opening date will need to be set for the $1.2 billion Transmission Gully project, Waka Kotahi says.

item.title: Community show love for baby found in Onehunga as search for mother continues
item.description: Police are still working through DNA evidence to identify the mother of a baby girl whose body was found at an Auckland recycling facility a month ago.

item.title: Momentum builds in capital but concern over Māori vaccine uptake
item.description: After a slower start Wellington's vaccination rollout has leaped ahead in recent weeks.

item.title: Dolphin group refloated north of Wellington
item.description: Rescuers have managed to free a group of dolphins that had become stranded in Porirua Harbour north of Wellington, however one of the dolphins has died.

item.title: One fatality after crash in Port Hills in Christchurch
item.description: One person has died in an early morning crash in Christchurch.

item.title: South leading for first shots of vaccine
item.description: The South's vaccination rollout has hit top gear, and the region leads the country in numbers of people who have had the first shot of the Pfizer vaccine.

item.title: Undies, clothing flushed down Māpua toilets clogging sewerage pumps
item.description: Tasman District Council engineers are baffled that clothing and underwear are being flushed down toilets in Māpua.
